website_summaries.verdict: Simple and yet popular game that features sturdy wooden construction in the blocks.
pros: Game play is different every time
Fun strategic game where players must take turns pulling wooden blocks out of the stack without tipping it over
Game works equally well for multiple players and solitaire play
Game appeals to wide age range
Includes sleeve to help you stack the blocks effectively
cons: Some blocks may have rough edges that cause problems with game play

website_summaries.verdict: A classic low-cost game that's tons of fun. It can be played solo, with two-players, or in a group.
pros: Compact size makes it easy to travel with
Requires no learning curve and is a nice mix of skill and luck
Games are short and sweet, but fulfilling
Blocks are simple to set up, so when they fall, it won't take long to play another round
cons: The build guide is made of cheap cardboard

customer_reviews.title: his journey towards the haze of my youth is wonderful. Peace
customer_reviews.text: Our family grew up together in some sort of Jenga haze where at every get together this was dragged out and we played for hours. Fast forward 15 years and I got this for my 3 year old (yeah, yeah, he doesn't have the manual dexterity or patience....Stop interrupting me) to pass that haze onto the next generation. Guess what, he loves Jenga!! Just not in the ultra competitive, beer fueled way. He views them as blocks, so we spend an hour or so each episode building stuff and knocking it down. Eventually we will start actually playing Jenga, but for now, his journey towards the haze of my youth is wonderful. Peace, No BS Guy
customer_reviews.author: No BS Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good game. It actually improves the focus of kids, because if you will lose the focus you may lose the game. The best part about it is, you can plaiit alone or with more players so you are not bound by number of players. I buyed it for my 8 years old son because he liked it so much. We have to actually remove each block at a time on your turn and make sure the tower should not loose the balance. Overall I like this game because you can spend hours playing this without getting bored as well you can finish it early if you have limited time. Overall worth it's price and good game.
customer_reviews.author: TEST

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an adult drinking game using google suggestions for each block, worked out well!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: Happy to see the wood pieces are still made of wood. That's about the only thing familiar you'll see from the last time you bought a Jenga game. The box is rectangle. The Jenga tower is square. The box contains cardboard padding that clearly is intended to be discarded. So now what? Put the bricks in the box and watch them shift around. It's like a bag of chips puffed up to look fuller. But why? And where's the plastic half cube that used to come with the set so you can easily straighten the tower? Not included, apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Summers-Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Well-made classic, but I wish it came with a bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this directly from Amazon, and it came new and wrapped in clear plastic. The inside block stack was also wrapped in plastic, which preserves the blocks until opening. The blocks are not painted, which allows them to stay together and the game to proceed normally without being shortened by premature slippage. The cardboard box is rectangular, and might serve as a storage mechanism for the blocks for awhile, but I suspect it will not last for that purpose. I'd prefer a storage bag, like several of the knock-offs that are marketed here have, but a bag might be found elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great fun which brings back memories
customer_reviews.text: Classic toy which provides fun for everyone. Really enjoyed reliving a game from the past. Pieces all appear uniform although I'm pretty sure the quality of the blocks are not as good as the original ones that were made. I'm sure these are lighter. The only other gripe is the very cheap cardboard guide that comes along with the game to assist you in rebuilding the tower once it's been toppled. I'd pay more if there was a better device to assist in building the tower again. Hours of fun that even our 4 year old was able to fully participate in. A non electronic game that holds your attention span..... amazing !
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Just As Exptected- thanks!
customer_reviews.text: This was just as expected. I was originally looking for a colored jenga set for a shower, but they were all double/triple the price so I bought this plain one and just painted the edges with cheap craft paint. See attached picture.
customer_reviews.author: ***ME***

customer_reviews.title: Be careful reading the description and Size
customer_reviews.text: Although I can't say it is entirely false advertising, using the word GIANT in bolder letters implies BIG, LARGE, OVERSIZED. Nope. The blocks are the size of blocks found in a nice wood building block set. See Melissa & Doug Solid Wood Building Blocks w/ Wooden Tray (60 Ct) for $59.00. BIG gripe is the cost of larger Jenga blocks that only stack 3 feet high. Seventy-five dollars ($75.00) is slightly pretentious, and the pictures are slightly misleading. However, it works like Smaller version Jenga,and my kids in play therapy get a kick out of it when it crashes. The box is sturdy enough for storing the blocks. Just don't get too excited, not a hot deal.
customer_reviews.author: J Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: It works, but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: If you are really into this game, you would care about the quality of the wood. Because if the wood is made of cheap compressed plywood or something, instead of dense hard wood, it would make a big difference when you try to pull a piece in the stack. The friction between woods will be enough to overcome the weight of the structure on top, thus causing the whole thing collapse more easily. Other than that, overall this is a good product given its price. I would recommend this product if you are a casual player and only play it sometimes as one of the many game you have handy.
customer_reviews.author: Z. YU

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Jenga Game to Play or Create a Lasting Memory
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this Jenga game to add more to our family Board Game Night. The game is authentic (having previously purchased this for my classroom). It's a super fun game and we had a ton of fun with it. I also recently attended a wedding and they had a Jenga game with Sharpies and asked every attendee to write a message to the couple so that when things seem like they're falling apart, they can read the messages together while they play Jenga as a reminder that sometimes things in a marriage aren't always perfect, but together they can rebuild it back to perfection. So cute!
customer_reviews.author: Live Love Laugh

customer_reviews.title: We used in place of guest book at our wedding.
customer_reviews.text: Always a fun game but now with memories attached. We used this at our wedding in place of a guest book. Everyone just signed a jenga piece. Now we play and we can read all the notes and guest who came to our special day!
customer_reviews.author: o_happy_home

customer_reviews.title: Always loved Jenga
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. We've gotten pretty good and most of our games end in stalemates where there are no available moves. We can keep playing by allowing two hands and attempting to restructure the tower so we can pull more blocks. We actually ended up just buying a second game and making the initial tower taller. I will agree with others that the boxes are stupid as all he--. I don't know why its a rectangle so the blocks don't fit without a struggle to center it. The cardboard cutouts used to fill in the spaces are flimsy and move around. It's so dumb so I took a star off for whatever twit designed the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Lost Quality Over the Years
customer_reviews.text: The Classic Jenga has turned into cheap junk. The "hardwood" feels more like styrofoam, the pieces are all slightly asymmetrical, and the wood burned logos are faded and inconsistent. How have they managed to mess up blocks? What happened here? My childhood is let down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blockhead
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. It keeps falling over!!! What a defective solid block of wood! Jenga must be Spanish for unsturdy disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tyrrell

customer_reviews.title: It's classic Jenga
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a box full of wooden blocks? They're exactly what you would expect. One thing I will say - I seem to remember years ago, when Jenga first came out, they gave you a nice plastic thingy that you could use to square up and straighten the stack of blocks. Now, it's just a cheap piece of thin cardboard. Not a big deal - you really don't even need it - but it is a change from before. Anyway, it's still a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great family game like always
customer_reviews.text: its hard to find a game easy enough for the 6 and under crowd that isnt boring for the adults but this one is a classic and my daughter thinks it is so much fun she also plays blocks with it building towers. here i was spending hundreds on christmas and what do you know this inexpensive board game takes the cake as one of her favorite gifts i think it good for concentrations as well she is a smart little girl so she wins half the time leaving the tower toppling down on the rest of us it fun to see you dont have to spend a lot to have a good time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jenga for therapists!
customer_reviews.text: As a brand new therapist, I've found that this game (especially with little open ended get to know you questions written on each piece) is fantastic for ice-breaking visits with new clients. It allows for something to do with hands, questions that can be ignored or used as either person feels like, and a subtle way to break up the awkwardness with getting to know you visits. This particular set is simple enough, and sturdy enough to be used as building blocks, domino tipping or as the game is meant to be played and it was affordable enough to get one for myself and my closest friend in gradschool with me. <3 love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Y. Regan MSW,CSW

customer_reviews.title: Plastic stacking sleeve, funky
customer_reviews.text: I had this game many years ago and it came with a heavy plastic sleeve for stacking. this one is as funky as they get. You have to keep all parts of the packaging if you want to put it away neatly, which never works. Rectangle box for square objects, lol! We learned this simple geometry when we were kids, it doesn't work Hasbro! I love the game but the manufacturer got really cheap this time around!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dinner parties, adults & kids alike
customer_reviews.text: Jenga is a classic. Purchased three of these to gift to friends, it's the ultimate housewarming gift, or even fitting to take to a dinner party. It's the perfect gift, but there is a caveat. There is a strange wood smell that we noticed on all the sets. Some of the blocks also don't fit perfectly together. Might not be a big deal, but if the misfit blocks happen to be in a few crucial junctures when playing, the Jenga tower will be even more imbalanced than it should be. Some might see this as a feature. What else do you expect for $10 or so?
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who will build the highest and who will, JENGA
customer_reviews.text: After 38 years TV is becoming boring so I decided to make a change. The change was do away with television every so often and Play a game. Wasn't sure what game the kids would actually like but Jenga was the win. It's easy for my five year old all the way up to my 43 year old big kid (my husband). This is a game we all get excited about. It's down to the steady pull and which one to take out. Don't be the shaky bottom pull or you could just be JENGA.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We have this game set up in our office breakroom. Everyone takes a turn while getting coffee/lunch. We all laugh when we hear it crash on the countertop. I've bought another game for our weekend camping. Sturdy game for a picnic table and great for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Brown

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun if you’re looking for a diversion that will make you laugh
customer_reviews.text: Never owned this game before, but I’ve played it. Thought it would be a good diversion for the spouse and myself during quarantine. Something non-electronic that we can do together. I was pleased with the outcome. A few evenings of real togetherness and laughs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Classic Game
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure we've all played this game. It's a lot of fun and can be played with 1 or 2 people which is great these days. The blocks are very sturdy and durable ready to last for years. My only complaint is that they used to come in a metal tin which made stacking them back and resetting for game quick and easy. These only have a cardboard shelf that you stack them on and then have to carefully slide out to reset. Still not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Muse

customer_reviews.title: Classic Jenga
customer_reviews.text: Basically what I ordered. I haven't seen the new Jenga, just the one I had in the 90's. What I appreciated about the old one was that there was this plastic cover so you could easily make the tower for the next game if you stacked it in the box. This box takes up space, there considerable space on the side, which I assume is because most people just want to throw the Jenga pieces in the box because they're LAZY. I will probably make a wooden box to store them, because I have limited storage on my bookshelves.
customer_reviews.author: Poiuytrew.q

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome. It came on time
customer_reviews.text: It's Jenga... it's awesome. It came on time. It was exactly what I expected. Now, I do think my kid was trying to cheat when we played, but that's not Jenga's fault. My kid also really liked building house after our game. When I recommend this game? You bet. It's fun. The instructions are on the side. You can get stricter with the rules if you wanted to. And if you decide you don't want to play anymore? Build a fortress with the blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Justyn VdP

customer_reviews.title: Decent, quality seems slightly poor
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Does the job for what I wanted but the pieces do feel slightly poor in quality. The wooden pieces feels a little fake compared to my past experiences with the game, so it’s not as satisfying to play with. The game box has some extra space when the tower is in the box, so it moves around inside, not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!!
customer_reviews.text: From some Amazon reviews that said kids had to spend more time stacking blocks than playing the game, I was somewhat doubtful about ordering Jenga. But because the game was reasonably priced, I decided to try it. I bought two for 6 year old grandchildren in different families. I played the first game with each of them. None of us had played Jenga before. Yet we all found it fun and challenging. Both kids could determine which blocks were best to remove, and they had the dexterity to play well. I am glad I took a chance!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A. Vokac

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to play with lots of different ages. My youngest kiddos will play by building things with the blocks and my older ones will play by the rules. Where it's simple to play/follow, it's a great game for them. I wish there was a case or something to keep all the pieces together, but I knew there wasn't going to be so I put them in a ziplock bag and that's worked so far. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Bunge

customer_reviews.title: No longer includes critical plastic piece to make the tower
customer_reviews.text: Jenga used to come with a plastic jig/template that allowed you to make a nice tight tower and thus play a fair game. They have replaced it with a piece of cardboard that is totally useless and really just packaging. Given how long the game has included it, I consider removing it akin to cheating me. While I don't think I have much standing to return it, I think it is a petty move and I have lost respect for the Hasbro because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fun game -- buy somewhere else!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger is better with Jenga! We had had the standard size game for many years, but the giant version is a lot more fun. But don't buy from Amazon if you plan to store the game in the manufacturer's box. They just apply shipping labels and send without additional packaging. Unacceptable!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: Classic game, great for all ages but hilarious with kids. I recently bought this again for a coworker's kid who is 4 and is now able to understand the mechanics of simple games like this and I can just imagine him cracking up laughing every time the tower tumbles. P.S. for a twist, write rules on each jenga piece so that whenever the block is pulled out, the action has to be taken by the player who pulled it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne dang

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Very fun. I love this game. We have it setup in the games area of our outdoor Gluten Free Café and plan to take it on our camping trip! All ages love it! Young & Old!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone! Jenna!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a classic and great for kids and adults alike. Great for large groups, one on one challenges and you can even play by yourself to see how far you can go before it all falls down. This game is simple to learn and you develop your own strategies how to more easily remove pieces as you go along. I love this game because depending on the setting, mood and who’s playing, it can be a quiet game or highly interactive with suspense and high energy.
customer_reviews.author: Valdiviez

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of this Jenga game for a party. I purchased one set for the adults and one set for the kids. When we received them we wrote comments on each of the blocks to add to the game. While the adults didn't actually get to play the game, the children did and had a blast. The game was very well put together and was lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Farm Chick

customer_reviews.title: Great game but product was defective.
customer_reviews.text: We received the product in time but some of the blocks had sticky glue on them.
customer_reviews.author: Mom Prime

customer_reviews.title: kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was missing out when I hadn't played jenga so I got it for my teen son for Xmas 2018 - it's not as fun as I expected. But he plays with his dad and they have fun. I know a social worker who puts questions on each block for her therapy sessions so that kids/families can talk while being distracted with a game. This is a great idea for teachers, too. building vocabulary, asking questions, writing prompts, etc. A nice game to have at home. Younger kids would love it, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: ParisUSA

customer_reviews.title: FUn got ALL ... Five to a hundred and five can play this game ..
customer_reviews.text: Fun , fun strategic game for 5 to 105 yo .. We laugh SO HARD at my house when we play . Had a set for years and was missing couple of pieces and one for marred up pretty bad by a dolly accident .. We ABSOLUTELY LOVE ❤️ this game . Nice interactive , gets people out of their sests for awhile .. FuN TO PLAY for ALL ...
customer_reviews.author: Tammie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for non readers
customer_reviews.text: It's easy and doesn't require a lot of instructions to play. My youngest doesn't read like my oldest and cant just play games alone without someone reading to her. So this was perfect. No playing cards to read off of. She plays and doesn't feel like she doesn't belong because she cant do what the big kids are doing. So it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: WatchMiCook

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. Couldn't stop playing with the family. I lost... A lot. Don't knock out a block like a jackhammer... it doesn't work. Game also comes with a cardboard V for you to restack the blocks quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Chie Vious

customer_reviews.title: Great game but..
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovable classic game but i wish that they included something in the box so that you can easily slide the completed tower in and out of the box. If you through away the cardboard that it came with (because you thought it was trash) you will be having a touch time putting the game away back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tech

customer_reviews.title: My Grand-kids love it
customer_reviews.text: What a great game for the entire family. My 3 grandkids are all under 8 and they love playing this game together as a family. Also great to help with children’s fine motor skills. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JG (Highflyer)Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one minor complete.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Japan and purchased this Jenga set for home use but at work I purchased a Japanese version for my students. Jenga's products are much higher quality. So no complaints there. Love the game. My only complete is why haven't they invited a better way to store it? The boxes shape doesn't accommodate the shape of the Jenga pieces. Basically when you put it in it falls apart! So you cannot store it stacked without a high probability of it falling apart inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: A classic, affordable, fun family game
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in blazing-fast Amazon fashion. From doorstep to first topple in minutes. Kids love the game. One improvement suggestion... these are wooden blocks, they probably don't need shrink-wrapped, ends padded, cushioned, and double-boxed...I'm guessing they'll hold up to shipping just fine! Great item for Amazon to make frustration-free!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great conversation piece during Christmas.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful wood! I love how dry the pieces were when they arrived! This made a nice fire during our Christmas present opening tradition. I did expect them to be larger, but I was never good at visualizing size. We possibly could have found cheaper lumber be it’s only a once a year tradition, so the price was acceptable. I would highly recommend this to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Strawleyder

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and fun for the family!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been cashing out on a bunch of games for the family in lieu of COVID-19 and being under quarantine and all. The first time I played this game, I started just playing with my sister. It ended up with my mom joining and then my dad. We played for hoursss and didn’t even realize how much time had went by. 10/10 I don’t regret buying this at all!
customer_reviews.author: Branda

customer_reviews.title: High quality at a very good deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play with my coworkers during lunch break. I did compare this one with other similar items, this is the only one has 52 pieces at this price, others are 48 pieces. It is a fun toy to play in office and give everyone a break from their phones.
customer_reviews.author: EviaT

customer_reviews.title: Great classic family game
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a few classic games for our home and this one seems to be the one that the family reaches for most regularly. The blocks are made well, even and stack together nicely. It provides hours of gaming fun and the experience is a little different each time. For the price it’s a nice addition to any home.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: Exactly how you imagine it would be. Nice box. No pieces missing until you play the game once. Then it never lines up again, but what do you care, that's not the point of the game. You came here to win and not to be pushed around by naysayers who talk more trash than they can actually follow through on. You're the real champion here.
customer_reviews.author: Glitter

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Its exactly as described: classic Jenga. We purchased the newer version of jenga which is the earthquake one that has plastic pieces and sits on a plastic square and that just didn't cut it for our family. I purchased this for our next game night, and it is exactly what we played when we were younger. Box arrived fast, no damage, no missing pieces. It is very sturdy and made well. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly W

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: We had a mini jenga game but this is the real deal. While my 5 year old likes building with them more than playing the game some time, we do manage to get a few games in before the building starts. Same great game it always has been. Just make sure you have stuff around the tower depending on what surface you're playing when it comes crashing down.
customer_reviews.author: The Natural

customer_reviews.title: Same great game, great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for nights when we have friends over. Everybody always reaches for Jenga the moment they come in. This is the same classic game that involves removing blocks to build up a tower until it collapses. The blocks seem well built, although there is some variability in size (as some reviewers noted). I'm not sure if this is intentional, as it allows some blocks to slide out more easily, which would make sense for the actual game. The amazon price is better than any I have seen in-store, good pick-up if you're looking for games to play with friends.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Classic like I remember
customer_reviews.text: They haven’t changed this game and that why I have it 5 stars. They have other versions, but love the classic. The block are the right size, shape, texture and still comes with the wedge that helps stack the blocks. Wonderful game we played in the boba shop and decided to get one for ourselves. Such fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Rom

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Jenga is a classic and therefore needs no introduction, and the specific set that is sold here is very decent indeed: the bricks seem sturdy and very even and well-made. My only gripe with this set is the restacking sleeve that comes with it, which is made out of cardboard and is a lot flimsier than the plastic version that was included in an earlier version I own of the game. Everything else is great though, so especially at this price, you can't really go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: SMT

customer_reviews.title: Another classic!
customer_reviews.text: I first ever played Jenga in elementary school as a kid. Me and the fellow students would rival each other and the teacher and have fun competitions. We'd win fun prizes from the teacher if we won! I had so much fun with that game - I personally still love it. It's a great party game and is suitable for children and adults.
customer_reviews.author: Brianne Martinez

customer_reviews.title: you cant beat the simple fun of this game
customer_reviews.text: i grew up with this game and found it very nostalgic now in my thirties wanted to get one again i saw so many options that really went outside of what the game is about simple and fun why spend more money for something that is very straight forward to do save yourself from other overprice items this is a must for any family or couple :)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Mego Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: Bought as Christmas gift for children.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (and about 60 other "like" items) to hand out to kids at a company Christmas party. You should have seen the excitement when they picked these out. I don't know whether or not they worked, easy or hard, messy or not... but I can tell you it got children excited in a project. I intentionally purchased items that would be fun to do as a family. I would definitely recommend again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: Jenga ends in either laughter or tears: there is no in-between
customer_reviews.text: Games don't get much more suspenseful than Jenga. This is a classic that never gets old, and can be played by young kids and seasoned adults alike. The suspense is palpable, and it's always fun screaming "Jenga!" at the top of your lungs when someone finally brings down the entire tower of blocks. This definitely brings out the competitiveness - as well as downright fear - in those playing. You know that bloodshed and animosity are going to be present at every holiday family gathering, so you might as well incite them with a seemingly innocuous game. Don't forget to harass the unlucky soul who makes the game collapse by wielding it over them for the remainder of the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Goo Goo

customer_reviews.title: Fun for entire family !!!
customer_reviews.text: You'll love this Jenga blocks...perfect for family time... spending time building tall towers and breaking previous record is total fun. Kids will definitely have loads of fun collapsing the tall tower each time and they will never get bored of this... definitely recommend this. Just one minor concern that stacking sleeve is cardboard one and not sturdy..wish this could be bit stronger cardboard so it lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeReviews👌

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Classic, sturdy and very nice. I love the blocks are soft .. and that makes the Jenga game as soft blocks tend to move easily ... and that’s the real fun. Bought this to have this game at my daughters bday party and also as a return gift for 10 year old boy.
customer_reviews.author: Sd

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a Jenga game. Very well made and high quality pieces too. Got the game to play with family over the holidays and we all had a blast The bigger the build, the harder the fall! It challenges you in every way. But that is the fun in the game. It takes skill, strategy, and luck. Includes 54 Jenga hardwood blocks, stacking sleeve with instructions. Lots of fun
customer_reviews.author: glennndahar

customer_reviews.title: Jenga game
customer_reviews.text: Had the game for myself already. Took it to my inlaws for the holiday and the children loved it. I purchased it for them. Kids love blocks and it was the perfect gift. They really don't know how to play they just loved stacking the blocks. The game itself is so much fun. The price was well worth it. I bought 3 on Amazon for the amount I paid for 1 in a brick and mortar. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Crayton

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so family and company can have some fun before and after dinner. I wanted a large size so this could be done away from my busy kitchen. When I bring this game out everyone has such a great time playing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best Game Ever!!!! Fun for kids & adults. Gave a set to 3 boys ages 9,10,12 for Christmas & they love playing it ...their Mom loves playing it with them, too This teaches concentration,,,, eye/hand coordination, dexterity. So much fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lou

customer_reviews.title: Well made classic game
customer_reviews.text: This classic game is so fun for my 5 year old! The wood is study, and smooth. We played while eating candy & popcorn and I was able to spot clean with soapy water. You'd never notice! Comes easy to set up, and packaging is perfect. I highly recommend this to kids of all ages!
customer_reviews.author: alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I brought this game for my grandson to play with me when he visits and we have the best time together with it. It's easy to put together and put away and is a fabulous game for adults to play together, my whole family has this game for themselves to play for game night.
customer_reviews.author: JJJ Designs

customer_reviews.title: Jenga Jenga Jenga!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got to know about this game when I first came to the USA 5 years ago. Very fun game to play with especially during cookouts and get-togethers. We bought this game from Amazon to play when we have guests at home. So far we love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Varun Rao P R

customer_reviews.title: What, no box?
customer_reviews.text: The game pieces are good quality. It comes with a sorting sleeve but not an actual container for the blocks. The box is a big enough for the blocks to spill out and I don’t see it surviving multiple road trips. I’ve used generic sets before that come with a tin to sort and store the blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Fun, classic game that everyone should own.
customer_reviews.text: I played this as a kid with my family and I'm playing it now as an adult with my friends when we have drinks for game night. At this price, its unbeatable and often a go-to for some good fun and laughs when I'm hanging with the guys and we get a little too tipsy for anything more thoughtful.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk D.

customer_reviews.title: Love this for one reason...
customer_reviews.text: We take this when we go to a restaurant or somewhere else where we know we will need to wait. All family members of various ages can play. (We do try to prevent a loud noise when the tower falls so as not to disturb other guests.)
customer_reviews.author: MCS1968

customer_reviews.title: It’s a classic.
customer_reviews.text: Classic Jenna....enough said. Really the only drawback was the box. It used to fit exactly to the game. It still has the form to line up the pieces but getting it into the box is obnoxious because there’s extra space for it to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Parsons

customer_reviews.title: my kids love this game!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up playing this game with my friends and cousins and just had to get it for my kids . My oldest is 4 and a half so wasn't sure he would be old enough but I ended up plying it with him and my 2 year old daughter and they both loved it! they both totally caught on how to play and then after were building their own stuff :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! I appreciate you. Thank you very much for the products you sell to make my life and the task in my life easier. Keep doing what you do, cause without you and people that make and sell these products where would we be.
customer_reviews.author: caldwell46

customer_reviews.title: True to it's name - a "Classic"
customer_reviews.text: We leave this out in our vacation rentals and it's a hit. Every time, they get into Jenga!! The box becomes a bit fragile once opened, we've taped it back up several times. Sometimes, people have trouble getting all the pieces back in, but we prefer to keep it in it's original box. A good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: Game is the same but the packaging is trash
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing classic about this. The packaging on the updated version is completely insane and makes absolutely no sense. The older version has a normal box to put the pieces away in, and they just slide right out. The new version is some complicated piece of trash filled with a bunch of extra cardboard pieces. Why is that? Because whoever designed this new version decided to make the box bigger than the pieces, so now there’s a bunch of unnecessary steps to put the damn thing away. Idiots. Don’t fix something that’s not broken!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and we love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not gave 5 star rating is, after we dump them out the box, very difficult to put them back in to the box. Wish they could have used aluminum tins to store and stack them back. This is my personnel opinion, outside to that no issues at all. Looks very quality, sturdy, good size and smooth finishing.
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: Great and fun game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't just a drinking game... I've had fun playing it with young kids, and then come up with variations on how to play it, such as if part of the tower falls down, just keep going with what you have left, each add pieces back one at a time, if you can get all the pieces to balance on the top, try taking them out again.... I'm almost thinking of buying this again to see what it's like if you stack both one another what it is like to play!
customer_reviews.author: desorbod

customer_reviews.title: Classic game!
customer_reviews.text: It's a classic game that's fun for everyone and doesn't take much to learn. Great for parties with adults or kids. For the price, this deal cannot be beat. I picked one up for my 3rd grade class and the kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: G. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: Just your basic Jenga game. My kids also love using the blocks for building things. My only complaint is that the box is a rectangle and has all this extra space on the side of where the blocks stack up – it makes no sense to me why you wouldn't just make a box that actually fits the stack of blocks and instead make it too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Can also be used a building blocks or dominoes!
customer_reviews.text: This game is one of the best value for money toys we have ever had. My son loves to play Jenga, but we have also used them as blocks to build a house, a fence, stairs, set them up as dominoes, etc. The wood they used is nice and smooth, no need to worry about splinters
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for young children and adults
customer_reviews.text: great games for the family, kids love to play it and definitely one of those games that will last for years as they grow. My children are 5 and 3.5 and they enjoy playing this game. Great game for holiday or birthday that the whole family can enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Addictive and Engaging :)
customer_reviews.text: Great Game and very engaging. removing each block carefully with hands shaking :) awesome. and best part is quality of blocks are very good. only thing i didn't like is, i expected it to be little bigger in size but that's okay. overall good experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chandan

customer_reviews.title: Fun game at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to share with a group of friends. It is a fun game that is good for any size group and you can even put your own twist on it and make challenge tiles by writing on them. This game comes with 52 wooden pieces and a guide to stack them neatly before you play.
customer_reviews.author: Renee T.

customer_reviews.title: We love game night and this was a great addition
customer_reviews.text: We love game night and this was a great addition. We had a lot of fun trying to find the loose blocks and trying to stack them so it wouldn't fall. I just wish it had come with a smaller box to fit the tower, to where you could stack them in the box and turn it up side down and then pull the box off so the tower would be straight and easier to stack in order to start the game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At my English club in China, this game is always the favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this game to my English club in China. I also brought many other games, but this game is always the star of the show. It is a great game and allows people of any skill level to sit and play at the same table. There is no reason to exclude anyone. You don't need to restrict the amount of players, so when guests arrive late or happen to walk by, they can reach in and have try. It's a great way to get people talking.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cedar

customer_reviews.title: Jenga!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game. Who doesn't love an excuse to crash wood blocks? My dog has managed to get a hold of a few and put some good teeth marks as well, but it doesn't seem to upset the balance of the tower.
customer_reviews.author: K Pitts

customer_reviews.title: A Good Game for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: this is a classic game for anyone. i bought this for my daughter’s birthday party and it was a very fun game. the anticipation of who will knock it down first is exhilarating. everything was perfectly intact and nothing was missing. highly recommend for anyone looking for a family game to play or something to pass the time.
customer_reviews.author: Netshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for family game night
customer_reviews.text: Always trying to find things to get the kids off their devices. This worked for a short time. My little one likes the blocks better than playing the game. Always a classic game in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fun for the family! I actually painted each of the blocks as a gift for my boyfriend with conversation prompts on each one, but it's perfect as-is as well. Beautiful wood pieces
customer_reviews.author: Hallie

customer_reviews.title: Classic addition to game night
customer_reviews.text: The blocks do not feel as smooth as the original, and the once plastic insert to align stack is now cardboard, which makes it a little more challenging to get in and out of the box. Great game our children love, as do adults. Add some alcohol to the mix, and it can become great entertainment for all.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible box/packaging
customer_reviews.text: The basic game itself is fine, it’s the packaging that is terrible. There is so much extra space in the box that it makes it difficult to put the game back inside without it falling apart. It’s not a huge issue and doesn’t hurt the playability of the game, it does make it annoying to pack it it away, however. Also, the art on the box is stupid and it does not look good on a game shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Good for all ages
customer_reviews.text: After I discovered Jenga I have gifted it to many people, of all ages! Help young folks learn coordination and planning, and help old folks keep their coordination and planning skills!!
customer_reviews.author: Bluebluesdancer

customer_reviews.title: Good ol' Jenga
customer_reviews.text: Same fun game from when I was a kid, and now I'm playing it when my kids. I love the simplicity of it while still maintaining its excitement and challenge. Perfect for this quarantine!
customer_reviews.author: s.mtz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fun for the whole Family
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this game. Even my 6 year old daughter learned it and got good in 1 day. Only negative......the game ONLY contains the blocks.....NO bag, box or any way to store the blocks.
customer_reviews.author: We Review Products

customer_reviews.title: Great game, needs better stacking guide.
customer_reviews.text: Game itself is fun. Four year old liked playing more than my eight year old. The guide for stacking is one level too short! It is also made of flimsy cardboard that now about a month after Christmas it isn’t even 90 degrees for the corner. Plan on finding inventive workarounds to stack evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Jenga! It is a classic
customer_reviews.text: I love Jenga! It is a classic. When I was looking for building blocks that were safe for my rabbits to play with, I though of Jenga! So yes, I sometimes play jingo with my bunnies and they love it! I also play it with my boyfriend and others as well. SO if anyone who is the owner of a rabbit is reading this review, you should get this to stimulate your bunny!
customer_reviews.author: baileejs

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a family event. We loved it. Be careful about the playing surface. When it falls it falls hard and with the block edges so it scared the table we were playing on. Super fun game though and bigger blocks are easy for young and old.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Fields

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: The classic game of jenga. Very fun, and my daughter loves knocking things over so it makes for a perfect combo. This is a newer version then the one that we had when we were younger as the building guide is now cardboard rather than the plastic that it used to be. I prefer the older plastic as it was a bit stronger and made it easier to put into and take out of the box. The cardboard is also a bit more flexible so it makes assembly a little more difficult. That is the only reason for the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: UCM

customer_reviews.title: Classic Fun
customer_reviews.text: A classic game that family and friends always love! Santa surprised the family this year with a fun gift for Christmas game night! We sure had fun, and the kids all especially enjoyed the blocks tumbling everywhere. Super quality blocks, reliable packaging, instructions were clear.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D

customer_reviews.title: wish the box was the right size
customer_reviews.text: sounds weird.. but i remember putting the box upside down as a child and pulling it up to have all the blocks in their built form ready to play. this set has a box that is too big so u have to build it urself even in the beginning. other then that game is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tower keeps falling over!
customer_reviews.text: I started playing this game but the other person I was playing with knocked the tower over and we had to restart. It happened again, seems to happen every time I play this game.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

product_meta.title: Jenga Classic Game
product_meta.description:
Size:ClassicIt's the classic block stacking, stack crashing game of Jenga. How will you stack up against the law of gravity? Stack the wooden blocks in a sturdy tower, then take turns pulling out blocks one by one until the whole stack crashes down. Is your hand steady enough to pull out the last block before the tower collapses?.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
It's the classic block-stacking, stack-crashing game of Jenga. How will you stack up against the law of gravity? Stack the wooden blocks in a sturdy tower, then take turns pulling out blocks one by one until the whole stack crashes down. Is your hand steady enough to pull out the last block before the tower collapses?

See more
feature_bullets: Pull out a block without crashing the stack to win at Jenga
Includes 54 Jenga hardwood blocks, stacking sleeve with instructions
It takes skill, strategy, and luck. Challenge yourself or play with friends
Win by being the last player to remove a block without causing the stack to crash

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
